Class Person

  • java.lang.Object
    • Person
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Individual

    public class Person
extends java.lang.Object
    SILKin's GUI is built on top of the KAES code donated my Michael Fischer; this is the class that Fischer created to represent people. When SILKin began to extensively modify this GUI, the Individual class was added as an extension to this class. SILKin code normally uses Individual instances, but uses the methods that Individual inherits from this class. Original KAES code, of course, directly accesses Person objects.

      • folks

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Individual> folks
        An ArrayList of all the Person instances ever made. If you know the serial number of any Individual, that is their index in this ArrayList.

      • hasEnded

        public boolean hasEnded()
        Modified this method for SILKin, since refYear is not used. Original version below:

        if (!deathYY.equals("") && !refYear.equals("")) return(deathYY.compareTo(refYear) <= 0);
        else return false;

      • drawLabel

        public void drawLabel(java.awt.Graphics g,
             java.awt.Rectangle theBounds)
        This is the method that writes a Person's name (or initials, or nothing) and kin term (or a letter, or nothing) beneath their symbol.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object on which to draw
        theBounds - the boundaries within which to draw

      • drawSymbol

        public void drawSymbol(java.awt.Graphics g,
              java.awt.Rectangle pbounds)
        Call the symbol for this Person's sex to draw itself. If this is a dead person, draw the End Symbol; otherwise draw the regular symbol. Then draw you label, if any.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object on which to draw
        pbounds - the boundaries within which to draw
